description: Declaring that it was her mountain, a Tellico Plains woman allegedly announced she was going to kill everybody and bury them on it May 29. Monroe County Sheriff's Deputy Dalton Rinehart said he spoke with a man around 9 p.m. that day and was told that earlier, around 2 p.m., the man and several other people were eating at William's Mountain Market and, as they were...
text:
Declaring that it was her mountain, a Tellico Plains woman allegedly announced
she was going to kill everybody and bury them on it May 29.

Monroe County Sheriff's Deputy Dalton Rinehart said he spoke with a man around
9 p.m. that day and was told that earlier, around 2 p.m., the man and several
other people were eating at William's Mountain Market and, as they were
leaving, Christy Lance, the man's ex-wife, pulled into the gas station area,
even though he has a restraining order against her and his work truck would
have let her know he was there.

The man told Rinehart his ex-wife and her boyfriend got out of the car and she
approached him while her boyfriend went into the store. The man said his ex-
wife demanded to know why he put her in jail, said she was going to bury them
all in the mountains and was cursing him.

Rinehart said he talked to the owner of the store and was told security
cameras weren't working, but he said he was there at the time and did witness
Lance causing a scene.

Rinehart said he talked to other witnesses who told him they had seen Lance
come to the store and was yelling at everyone and that she got her dog out of
the back of her truck and cursed her ex-husband in front of everyone. One
witness said Lance did state the mountain belonged to her and she was going to
bury everyone on it.

The man told Rinehart he was scared his ex-wife would try to harm him and that
he wanted her arrested for violating the order of protection. Rinehart said he
checked and found Lance had been arrested on May 21 for violating the order by
showing up at her ex-husband's house.

Rinehart issued an order for Lance's arrest. Lance, 36, Tellico Plains, will
be charged with domestic violence, violating an order of protection and
stalking.

keywords.text: Monroe County Sheriff's Deputy Dalton Rinehart

title: Woman says she's going to bury everybody on her mountain
html:
Declaring that it was her mountain, a Tellico Plains woman allegedly announced she was going to kill everybody and bury them on it May 29.

Monroe County Sheriff's Deputy Dalton Rinehart said he spoke with a man around 9 p.m. that day and was told that earlier, around 2 p.m., the man and several other people were eating at William's Mountain Market and, as they were leaving, Christy Lance, the man's ex-wife, pulled into the gas station area, even though he has a restraining order against her and his work truck would have let her know he was there.

The man told Rinehart his ex-wife and her boyfriend got out of the car and she approached him while her boyfriend went into the store. The man said his ex-wife demanded to know why he put her in jail, said she was going to bury them all in the mountains and was cursing him.

Rinehart said he talked to the owner of the store and was told security cameras weren't working, but he said he was there at the time and did witness Lance causing a scene.

Rinehart said he talked to other witnesses who told him they had seen Lance come to the store and was yelling at everyone and that she got her dog out of the back of her truck and cursed her ex-husband in front of everyone. One witness said Lance did state the mountain belonged to her and she was going to bury everyone on it.

The man told Rinehart he was scared his ex-wife would try to harm him and that he wanted her arrested for violating the order of protection. Rinehart said he checked and found Lance had been arrested on May 21 for violating the order by showing up at her ex-husband's house.

Rinehart issued an order for Lance's arrest. Lance, 36, Tellico Plains, will be charged with domestic violence, violating an order of protection and stalking.
